questions.question: What is the empirical formula of InP-1?
What technique was used for the solid-state cyclic voltammograms measurements?
What is the space group of InP-2?
What solvent was used for the synthesis of InP-3?
questions.answer: A mixture of water, pyridine, and DMF

questions.question: What was the yield of InP-1?
Is the InP-1 catalyst recyclable?
Was DABCO used as a cocatalyst in the control experiment for the β-arylation of propionaldehyde?
questions.answer: Yes, DABCO was used as a cocatalyst in the control experiment.

questions.question: Did the β-functionalization of saturated ketones require the use of LiAsF6?
questions.answer: Yes, the β-functionalization of saturated ketones required the use of LiAsF6.

questions.question: What was the conversion percentage for the β-arylation of valeraldehyde using InP-1?
questions.answer: The conversion percentage for the β-arylation of valeraldehyde using InP-1 was 67%.

questions.question: How was the enantioselectivity of the β-arylation products determined?
questions.answer: The enantioselectivity of the β-arylation products was determined by HPLC analysis.

questions.question: Does the interpenetration of frameworks in InP-1 enhance the enantioselectivity of the β-functionalization products?
questions.answer: True, the interpenetration of frameworks in InP-1 enhances the enantioselectivity of the β-functionalization products.

questions.question: Was the reaction mixture for the β-functionalization of saturated ketones extracted with ethyl acetate?
questions.answer: Yes, the reaction mixture for the β-functionalization of saturated ketones was extracted with ethyl acetate.

questions.question: What was the role of DABCO in the β-arylation reaction?
questions.answer: DABCO acted as a base in the β-arylation reaction.

questions.question: Was the β-arylation reaction performed under light irradiation?
questions.answer: True, the β-arylation reaction was performed under light irradiation.

questions.question: What was the purpose of using LiAsF6 in the β-functionalization of saturated ketones?
questions.answer: LiAsF6 was used to facilitate the electron transfer process in the β-functionalization of saturated ketones.

questions.question: Did the synthesis of InP-3 involve the use of DCC and DMAP?
questions.answer: False, the synthesis of InP-3 did not involve the use of DCC and DMAP.

questions.question: What was the crystal system of InP-2?
questions.answer: The crystal system of InP-2 was monoclinic.

questions.question: Was the β-functionalization reaction catalyzed by InP-1 selective towards the β-position of carbonyls?
questions.answer: True, the β-functionalization reaction catalyzed by InP-1 was selective towards the β-position of carbonyls.

questions.question: What was the conversion percentage for the β-arylation of propionaldehyde using InP-1?
questions.answer: The conversion percentage for the β-arylation of propionaldehyde using InP-1 was 87%.

questions.question: How was the porosity of InP-1 determined?
questions.answer: The porosity of InP-1 was determined by PLATON software and dye-uptake assay.
